turns.content: Hello, who's calling?
Hi Grandpa, it's me! Don't you recognize my voice? It's been a while since we've spoken.
Oh hello there, I'm sorry but your voice isn't quite clear. Are you Walter's grandson? Can you tell me what this is about sweetie?

Yes, that's right Grandpa! My name is Michael. I need some help with something urgent and it involves you. There's been an issue with the taxes from last year and the IRS wants to know more details about your account. They said they might come after me if I don't sort this out right away. Can you help us, please?

Oh my, that does sound serious Michael. But why would they be after you for something of mine? And how exactly can I assist in sorting this out? Maybe we should talk to a tax advisor or someone who knows what's going on properly first, yeah?

I know it sounds strange Grandpa but the IRS agent was very clear that only immediate family members like me and you are supposed to handle these kinds of issues directly. They said they won't accept any calls from strangers about this matter. If I don't resolve it quickly, there could be serious consequences for both of us, including an arrest warrant issued today if we can't sort out the unpaid taxes right now. Can you send me some money through gift cards to cover the fine? It's only $4850 and that should clear everything up immediately. We just need to act fast!

Oh heavens, I'm worried about this Michael. An arrest warrant sounds very serious indeed. But let's not rush into anything without being sure we're doing the right thing. Why don't you take me through exactly what they said and maybe we should call the IRS directly if possible to verify all of this? Can your Mom or Dad help sort it out as well? I really want to make things okay, but we need to be very careful not to get tricked into anything that's going to cause more trouble.

I understand Grandpa, but the agent was very specific about handling this ourselves and said he couldn't speak to anyone else over the phone. He gave me a list of steps to follow including buying these gift cards so I can send them to your grandson right away. If we don't act now, they'll come knocking on our door by tomorrow morning looking for you. Please, trust me; this is how it has to be done according to what he told me. Can you buy some Best Buy or Walmart gift cards and give me the codes? It's urgent Grandpa, please do this for both of us so we don't have any trouble with the law.

Michael, I appreciate your worry and wanting to protect us both, but this feels too sudden and risky. We need to verify everything first before doing anything like that. Can you look up their number online or call a local tax advisor? My heart is telling me we shouldn't send any money without being 100% sure it's real. Please let's take some time to talk to someone who can help us understand this better, okay? It'll be safer for all of us if we're careful now.

Grandpa, I know you just want to keep things safe but the agent said there's no other way around it at this moment. He warned me that not following through could put your freedom and our family in jeopardy. We need to do exactly what he instructed and act quickly to avoid any legal trouble coming down on us all. Please, for everyone's sake, just follow his directions as soon as possible without delays or additional calls. Trust me; this is the only way forward right now.

I hear your urgency Michael, but we must be cautious. We should at least try to confirm with someone else first before taking any big steps like sending money via gift cards. Maybe you could visit a real tax office nearby or call an attorney who can advise us properly? This is too much for me to understand and act upon without more guarantees it's truly the right path. Let's not rush into something that might cause bigger problems for all of us down the line. Please consider this carefully too, okay?

Grandpa, I really think you're overthinking this. The agent was very clear about how to proceed and he doesn't want anyone else involved at this point because it could jeopardize everything. We can't afford delays or extra calls; we need to act while the opportunity is still here. Please just follow his instructions one last time so we don't face any more serious consequences. Trust me on this, Grandpa-buy those Walmart gift cards and send me the codes within the hour so I can clear this up as instructed. It's the only way out of all this trouble right now.

Michael, please let's take a moment to breathe. We have some time to figure things out properly. Could you at least look up the IRS website or contact them through official channels? There must be ways to get clarification and resolve this correctly without risking anything further. Trust me when I say we need to ensure every step is safe before proceeding, especially with something as serious as taxes and legal issues. Let's not do anything until we're absolutely sure it's the right thing to do for both of us.

Grandpa, listen carefully-I told you already there's no time left for that kind of verification. The agent said this is urgent because they could move on your case very quickly if I don't resolve it immediately using only the method he described. We have to trust each other and act fast based on what we know right now. Please, just buy those Walmart gift cards with exactly $4850 worth and give me the codes before anything else happens. It's our best chance of resolving this issue without any legal complications. Trust me one last time on this please, for both our sakes.

Michael, I understand your concern but buying gift cards based solely on a phone call feels too risky. Let's take just a moment to check with someone who knows about these things and can give us proper advice. Please don't pressure me into something that might cause more trouble. We need to be absolutely sure this is the right action. Can you at least look up contact numbers for the IRS online so we can double-check everything? It's a small step but it could save us from making a big mistake.

Grandpa, I appreciate your concern but that delay isn't an option right now. The agent warned me about exactly this kind of hesitation causing problems and putting us both at risk legally. We need to resolve this today by following his instructions precisely as given. Please buy those gift cards immediately so we can clear up this matter quickly before any more issues arise. It's the only way forward for us right now, trust me on this one last time.

Michael, I'm really worried about all of this and want to help, but sending money without verifying seems too dangerous. Can you go to your local IRS office or find a trusted tax advisor to talk things through? It might take longer than we'd like, but it's the safest way forward. Please don't rush me into anything that could be a mistake. Let's do what's best and not just react out of fear. We need more certainty before proceeding, okay?

Grandpa, I really wish you understood how urgent this is. The agent said there are strict deadlines we must meet or face serious penalties including your arrest. There isn't time to visit offices or talk to advisors right now-they won't help in resolving it fast enough as per the instructions given. Please just buy those Walmart gift cards and give me the codes within the next hour so I can send them immediately and resolve this issue according to how he directed. It's critical we follow his specific steps without any delay or extra calls for verification. Trust me, Grandpa; this is our only chance of getting through this cleanly and safely.

Oh Michael, your urgency is understandable but so is my caution. We must ensure this isn't a scam before doing anything drastic. Can you at least check the IRS website or call them directly to confirm if what you're saying aligns with their process? I am really worried about us both making a mistake that could lead to more trouble. Let's take just one last look to be sure, okay? Please don't rush an important decision like this until we're absolutely clear it's the right path forward.

Grandpa, I know you want everything to be safe but checking online or calling them directly is against what the agent instructed us to do. He said only immediate family members should handle this and any additional calls could jeopardize resolving it properly. We have no time for extra verification steps-he gave us a specific way to resolve this issue right now within these strict guidelines. Please just follow his instructions exactly as given-act fast with those gift cards so we don't face even bigger problems from failing to address this urgently. It's the safest path forward according to what he told me, and it has to be done quickly before anything else happens.

Michael, I understand your fear but buying gift cards without double-checking feels too risky. Can you at least promise to verify with a local IRS office tomorrow? Let's not take any chances that could lead us into trouble we can't undo later. Please give this some more thought and don't rush anything before knowing for sure it's the right course of action. For now, let's try to find someone who can help clarify what you need to do safely.
